catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 462
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: two narrow waterfalls on either side of one wider waterfall cascading from a billowing rock formation; waterfalls separate over boulders at bottom; inscription written in gold across center of image within fog
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, and Seals

Center: (Recorded at viewing the Kegon Waterfall, in early . . . [untranslated])
markings: Seal UR edge and L edge C: (Shiba Sanjin); (Sekikeiei in); (Kunka)
medium: Ink, color, and gold on silk
object_name: Hanging scroll, one of a triptych
signed: C, in gold: (Kōsai koi Ishikawa Ten)
title: Kegon Falls [center of a triptych of Kegon Falls and Flowers]
